TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IFeatureSupport

Docs.summary: Specifies a standard interface for retrieving feature information from the current system.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When implemented in a class, IFeatureSupport provides methods you can use to determine whether a feature is currently installed on the system and to get the version number of a feature. Call <xref:System.Windows.Forms.IFeatureSupport.IsPresent%2A> to determine whether a feature, or a specific version of a feature, is currently installed. Call <xref:System.Windows.Forms.IFeatureSupport.GetVersionPresent%2A> to determine the version number of an installed feature.
See the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FeatureSupport> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OSFeature> classes for implementations of this interface.
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OSFeature> implementation of IFeatureSupport and queries for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OSFeature.LayeredWindows> feature. The version is checked to see if it is `null`, to determine whether the feature is present. The result is displayed in a text box. This code assumes `textBox1` has been created and placed on a form.
[!code-cs[Classic OSFeature Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.i_18_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Classic OSFeature Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.i_18_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[Classic OSFeature Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.windows.forms.i_18_1.cpp)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Version GetVersionPresent(object feature) cil managed

Docs.param: The feature whose version is requested.
Docs.summary: Retrieves the version of the specified feature.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.Version> representing the version number of the specified feature; or if the feature is not installed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For an implementation of this method, see <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OSFeature.GetVersionPresent%2A>.
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OSFeature> implementation of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.IFeatureSupport> and queries for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OSFeature.LayeredWindows> feature. The version is checked to see if it is `null`, to determine whether the feature is present. The result is displayed in a text box. This code assumes `textBox1` has been created and placed on a form.
[!code-cs[Classic OSFeature Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.windows.forms.i_8_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Classic OSFeature Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.windows.forms.i_8_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[Classic OSFeature Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.windows.forms.i_8_1.cpp)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsPresent(object feature) cil managed

Docs.summary: Determines whether any version of the specified feature is currently available on the system.
Docs.returns: if the feature is present; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OSFeature> implementation of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.IFeatureSupport> and queries for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OSFeature.LayeredWindows> feature. The version is checked to see if it is `null`, to determine whether the feature is present. The result is displayed in a text box. This code assumes `textBox1` has been created and placed on a form.
[!code-cs[Classic OSFeature Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.windows.forms.i_2_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Classic OSFeature Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.windows.forms.i_2_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[Classic OSFeature Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.windows.forms.i_2_1.cpp)]

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsPresent (object feature, Version minimumVersion);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsPresent(object feature, class System.Version minimumVersion) cil managed

Docs.param: A <xref:System.Version> representing the minimum version number of the feature to look for.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the specified or newer version of the specified feature is currently available on the system.
Docs.returns: if the requested version of the feature is present; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OSFeature> implementation of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.IFeatureSupport> and queries for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OSFeature.LayeredWindows> feature. The version is checked to see if it is `null`, to determine whether the feature is present. The result is displayed in a text box. This code assumes `textBox1` has been created and placed on a form.
